itemDescription: Roman Catholic priest and Abbot of Downside Abbey

wikipedia_page.main:
John Chapman  (25 April 1865 – 7 November 1933) was an English Roman Catholic priest, received into the Roman Catholic Church at the age of 25, the 4th Abbot of Downside Abbey of the English Benedictine Congregation from 1929 until his death, and a New Testament and patristics scholar.
He is best known for having founded one of the independent schools in Britain: Worth, in West Sussex.
